Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "We still don't know who the culprit is! And {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama is an important honored guest to the Master...!"
Steam (ST): "We still don't know who the culprit is! And {f:5:Beatrice}-sama is an important and honored guest of the Master's...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "We still don't know who the culprit is! And Beatrice-sama is an important honored guest to the Master...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「誰が犯人かはまだわかりませんぞ！　それにベアトリーチェさまは、お館様の大切な賓客です…！」
Russian (RU): "Мы всё ещё не знаем, кто преступник! И {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама самая почетная гостья господина!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nós ainda não sabemos quem é o culpado! E, para o Mestre, a {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama é uma convidada muito importante e honrada...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「還不知道誰是犯人呢！再說，貝阿朵莉切夫人可是老爺重要的賓客啊…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「还不知道谁是犯人呢！再说，贝阿朵莉切夫人可是老爷重要的宾客啊…！」
Italian (IT): "Ancora non sappiamo chi sia il colpevole! E per il padrone, {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama è un'ospite d'onore importante...!"
Turkish (TR): "Suçlunun kim olduğunu hâlâ bilmiyoruz! Ve {f:5:Beatrice}-sama, Efendi için çok önemli bir onur konuğu...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "So what?!! If we grab her by the collar, she'll definitely confess!! If we can look her in the eye, we'll know!! I'll see through her!! A witch?! {f:5:Beatrice}?!! I'll expose her for who she is!!"
Steam (ST): "So what?!! If we grab her by the collar, she'll definitely confess!! If I can just look her in the eye, I'll know. I'll see through her!! A witch?! {f:5:Beatrice}?!! Yeah, right! I'll expose her!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So what?!! If we grab that person by the collar, they'll definitely confess!! If we can look them in the eye, we'll know. I'll see through her!! A witch?! Beatrice?!! I'll expose her!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「だから何だってんだッ！！　本人の胸倉、捻り上げてやれば白状するに決まってるぜ！！　目を見ればわかるんだよッ！！　私が見破ってやる！！　何が魔女だベアトリーチェだッ！！　バケの皮を剥いでやるッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ну и что?!! Если прижать эту особу к стенке, она обязательно признается! Если мы посмотрим ей в глаза, мы точно узнаем. Я смогу увидеть её насквозь! Ведьма?! {f:5:Беатриче}?!! Я раскрою её!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E daí?! Se a agarrarmos pelo colarinho, ela definitivamente vai confessar!!{n}Se olharmos nos olhos dela, nós saberemos!! Eu verei através dela!! Uma bruxa?! {f:5:Beatrice}?! Vou expô‐la por quem ela é!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那又如何！！只要拎起她胸口，她就肯定會招！！一看她眼睛，就能知道！！我來識破她！！什麼魔女啊，貝阿朵莉切啊！！我來撕了她那張畫皮！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那又如何！！只要拎起她胸口，她就肯定会招！！一看她眼睛，就能知道！！我来识破她！！什么魔女啊，贝阿朵莉切啊！！我来撕了她那张画皮！！」
Italian (IT): "E quindi?!! Se la prendiamo per il bavero state certi che confesserà!!{n}Lo capiremo guardandola negli occhi!! La smaschererò!! Che razza di strega dovrebbe essere {f:5:Beatrice}?!! La esporrò per quella che è veramente!!"
Turkish (TR): "Ne olmuş yani?!! Yakasına yapışırsak, kesinlikle suçunu itiraf edecektir!! Gözlerinin içine bakabilirsek, gerçeği anlarız!! Yalanlarına kanmayacağım!! Bir cadı mı?! {f:5:Beatrice} mi?!! Gerçek kimliğini ifşalayacağım!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica never stopped moving.{n}Gohda and Kanon chased after her, doing their best to convince her, but Jessica never lent them an ear.
Steam (ST): Jessica never stopped moving. Gohda and Kanon chased after her, doing their best to convince her to stop, but Jessica never lent them an ear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica never stopped moving. Gohda and Kanon chased after her, doing their best to convince her, but Jessica never lent them an ear.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は決して足を止めなかった。郷田と嘉音は早足に追いながら懸命に説得を続けるが、朱志香は決して耳を貸そうとはしなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 朱志香は決して足を止めなかった。{n}郷田と嘉音は早足に追いながら懸命に説得を続けるが、朱志香は決して耳を貸そうとはしなかった。
Russian (RU): Джессику было не остановить.{n}Года и Канон погнались за ней, делая всё возможное, чтобы переубедить её, но Джессика даже не слушала их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica não parava de se mover.{n}Gohda e Kanon seguiram atrás dela, fazendo o seu melhor para convencê‐la, mas Jessica não deu ouvidos a eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香絲毫沒有停下過腳步。{n}雖然鄉田和嘉音在一邊快步追趕，一邊拚命地勸說著她，但朱志香絲毫沒有想過要去聽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香丝毫没有停下过脚步。{n}虽然乡田和嘉音在一边快步追赶，一边拼命地劝说着她，但朱志香丝毫没有想过要去听。
Italian (IT): Jessica non fermò mai i propri passi.{n}Gouda e Kanon la tallonavano, continuando a fare del loro meglio per persuaderla, ma Jessica non diede loro ascolto neanche una volta.
Turkish (TR): Jessica hiç durmadan koşmaya devam etti.{n}Gohda ve Kanon onu ikna etmek için ellerinden geleni yaparak peşinden koştular, ama Jessica onlara hiç kulak asmadı.

Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, the "Witch's VIP Room" came into view.{n}This VIP room was always sealed and never used.
Steam (ST): Eventually, the witch's VIP room came into view. This VIP room was always sealed and never used.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, the witch's VIP room came into view. This VIP room was always sealed and never used.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、“魔女の貴賓室”が見えてくる。この貴賓室は、決して使われることのない開かずの間だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): やがて、“魔女の貴賓室”が見えてくる。{n}この貴賓室は、決して使われることのない開かずの間だった。
Russian (RU): В конце концов, показалась и "почетная гостевая комната для ведьмы".{n}Почетная гостевая комната, находящаяся под запретом и никогда не использовавшаяся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente, o "Quarto VIP da Bruxa" tornou‐se visível.{n}Este quarto VIP estava sempre selado e nunca era usado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不久，“魔女的貴賓室”映入了眼簾。{n}這間貴賓室，是間從不會被任何人使用的，不會開啟的房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不久，“魔女的贵宾室”映入了眼帘。{n}这间贵宾室，是间从不会被任何人使用的，不会开启的房间。
Italian (IT): Alla fine, ‘la sala VIP della strega’ entrò nel loro raggio visivo.{n}La sala VIP era una stanza mai utilizzata, e tenuta sempre chiusa...
Turkish (TR): Sonunda, "Cadı'nın VIP Odası" görüş alanlarına girdi.{n}Bu VIP odası her zaman kapalı tutulurdu ve asla kullanılmazdı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...No matter what kind of guest came, Kinzo wouldn't let them in this room.
Steam (ST): ...No matter what kind of guest came, Kinzo wouldn't let them in there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …どのような来客であっても、金蔵はこの部屋に通さなかったのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Независимо от того, какой статус был у гостей, посещавших Роккенджиму, Кинзо не допускал их в эту комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Não importa que tipo de hóspede viesse, Kinzo não o deixaria entrar no quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不論是什麼樣的來客，金藏都從未讓他們進入過此處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不论是什么样的来客，金藏都从未让他们进入过此处。
Italian (IT): Kinzo non avrebbe mai fatto entrare un ospite in quella stanza, a prescindere da chi fosse...
Turkish (TR): ...Ne tür bir misafir gelirse gelsin, Kinzo kimsenin bu odayı kullanmasına izin vermezdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......And yet, the servants were always made to clean this room, so that it could be used at any time.
Steam (ST): ...And yet, the servants were always made to clean this room, so that it could be used at any time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……なのに、使用人たちには常にこの部屋を掃除させ、いつでも使用できるようにさせていた。
Russian (RU): ......И всё равно, слуги всегда прибирали эту комнату, так что её можно было использовать в любое время.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ainda assim, os serviçais tinham sempre de limpar o quarto, para que ele pudesse ser usado a qualquer hora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可儘管如此，他卻讓傭人們時常打掃它，使其隨時都能使用。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可尽管如此，他却让佣人们时常打扫它，使其随时都能使用。
Italian (IT): Ciononostante, era sempre stata fatta pulire dai domestici, in modo da poter essere usata in qualsiasi momento.
Turkish (TR): ......Yine de, her zaman kullanılabilir durumda olabilmesi için hizmetkârlara bu odanın temizliği yaptırılırdı.

Umineko Project (UP): So the servants had started calling this room the "Witch's VIP Room", after their other shapeless master.
Steam (ST): So the servants had started calling this room the witch's VIP room, after their second, shapeless master.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So the servants had started calling this room the witch's VIP room, after their other shapeless master.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこの部屋を使用人たちは、姿なきもうひとりの主の部屋、“魔女の貴賓室”と呼ぶようになっていたのだ。
Russian (RU): Так слуги и прозвали эту комнату "почётной гостевой комнатой для ведьмы", их другой бестелесной госпожи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso os serviçais haviam começado a chamá‐lo de o "Quarto VIP da Bruxa", lembrando sua outra mestra sem‐forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，傭人們就漸漸地，把這間沒有身形的另一位主人的房間，稱為了“魔女的貴賓室”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，佣人们就渐渐地，把这间没有身形的另一位主人的房间，称为了“魔女的贵宾室”。
Italian (IT): Perciò i domestici avevano iniziato a chiamarla ‘la sala VIP della strega’, ossia la stanza dell'altra padrona priva di forma.
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden hizmetkârlar, diğer formsuz efendilerine ithafen bu odaya "Cadı'nın VIP Odası" demeye başlamışlardı.

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica also knew this. And she couldn't stand that woman's arrogance in calling herself a witch, by staying in that room.
Steam (ST): Jessica knew about this too. And she couldn't forgive the arrogance of the one who called herself a witch by staying in that room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica also knew this. And she couldn't forgive the arrogance of the one who called herself a witch and stayed in that room.
PC Japanese (JP): それは朱志香も知っていた。そして、その貴賓室に泊まることで、自らを魔女と名乗る傲慢が許せなかった。
Russian (RU): Джессика тоже знала об этом. И она не могла простить надменность той, кто назвала себя ведьмой и разместилась в этой комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica também sabia disso. E ela não conseguia aturar a arrogância daquela mulher em se chamar de uma bruxa, ficando naquele quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香也知道這一點。而且她也無法容忍，憑著住進這間貴賓室，而自稱魔女的那份傲慢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香也知道这一点。而且她也无法容忍，凭着住进这间贵宾室，而自称魔女的那份傲慢。
Italian (IT): Anche Jessica ne era a conoscenza. E non poteva perdonare l'arroganza di definirsi una strega mediante il risiedere in quella sala...
Turkish (TR): Jessica bunu biliyordu. Ve, o odada kalarak kendine cadı diyen kadının küstahlığına katlanamıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......The Golden Witch was just a fairy tale. Come on, a witch?! To Jessica, she was nothing more or less than the murderer who had brutally killed her parents!
Steam (ST): ...The Golden Witch was just a fairy tale. Come on, a witch?! To Jessica, she was nothing more or less than the murderer who had brutally killed her parents!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The Golden Witch was just a fairy tale. Come on, a witch?! To Jessica, she was nothing more or less than the murderer who had brutally killed her parents!
PC Japanese (JP): ……黄金の魔女などおとぎ話だ。何が魔女だ！　自分にとっては、両親を惨たらしく殺した殺人者以上でも以下でもない！
Russian (RU): ......Золотая Ведьма была просто сказкой. Да бросьте, ведьма?! Для Джессики она была всего лишь убийцей, жестоко убившей её родителей!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A Bruxa Dourada era só um conto de fadas. Qual é, uma bruxa?! Para Jessica, ela não era nada mais nada menos do que a assassina que tinha matado seus pais brutalmente!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……黃金的魔女只是騙小孩的故事。什麼魔女啊！對我來說，不過就是個殘忍殺害了我爸媽的殺人犯！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……黄金的魔女只是骗小孩的故事。什么魔女啊！对我来说，不过就是个残忍杀害了我爸妈的杀人犯！
Italian (IT): La Strega Dorata era solo una favoletta. Ma quale strega?! Per lei era soltanto l'assassina che aveva brutalmente ucciso i suoi genitori!
Turkish (TR): ......Altın Cadı sadece bir peri masalıydı. Hadi ama, bir cadı mı?! Jessica'ya göre, o kadın ailesini vahşice öldüren bir katilden başka bir şey değildi!

Umineko Project (UP): Question her, make her give painful excuses, make her spit at the ground painfully, make her breathe painfully.
Steam (ST): Question her, hear her pitiful excuses, make her splutter in pain, gasp in anguish.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Question them, make them give painful excuses, spit it out painfully, breathe painfully.
PC Japanese (JP): 問い詰められ、苦しい言い訳を吐き、苦しい唾を吐いて苦しい息を吐いて。
Russian (RU): Допросить её, вынудить мучительно оправдываться, исходить болью, дышать с болью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Questione‐a, faça‐a dar desculpas dolorosas, faça‐a cuspir no chão dolorosamente, faça‐a respirar sufocadamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我會逼問得你，氣喘吁吁、費盡口沫地吐出站不住腳的詭辯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我会逼问得你，气喘吁吁、费尽口沫地吐出站不住脚的诡辩。
Italian (IT): L'avrebbe pressata di domande, per poi farle chiedere scusa, sputare e ansimare in preda al dolore...
Turkish (TR): Onu sorgulayacağım, acılar içinde mazeret uydurmasını, acılar içinde yere tükürmesini, acılar içinde nefes almasını sağlayacağım.

Umineko Project (UP): ...No matter how hard she pretends to be a witch, I'll teach her that she's just a stinking, sweaty {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}!!
Steam (ST): ...No matter how hard she pretends to be a witch, I'll teach her that she's just a stinking, sweaty Human!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...No matter how hard she pretends to be a witch, I'll teach her that she's just a stinking, sweaty human!!
PC Japanese (JP): …どんなに魔女を装おうとも、汗臭いニオイのするニンゲンであることを教えてやるッ！！
Russian (RU): ...Неважно, насколько упорно она пытается выставить себя ведьмой, я покажу ей, что она всего лишь подлый, ничтожный {y:0:Челове}{n:0:челове}к!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Não importa o quanto ela finja ser uma bruxa, ensinarei a ela que ela é só uma {y:0:Humana}{n:0:humana} fedorenta e suada!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …管你怎麼裝魔女，我都會讓你明白，你只是個散發著汗臭的人類！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): …管你怎么装魔女，我都会让你明白，你只是个散发着汗臭的人类！！
Italian (IT): Poteva fingere di essere una strega quanto voleva, le avrebbe insegnato che era una semplice {y:0:Umana}{n:0:umana} che puzzava di sudore!!
Turkish (TR): ...Ne kadar cadı numarası yaparsa yapsın, ona sadece kokuşmuş, terli bir {y:0:İnsan}{n:0:insan} olduğunu öğreteceğim!

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica hit the door to the VIP room while yelling with all of her strength.
Steam (ST): As Jessica yelled with all of her strength, she hit the door to the VIP room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Jessica yelled with all of her strength, she hit the door to the VIP room.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香はあらん限りの力と大声をあげながら、貴賓室の扉を叩く。
Russian (RU): Когда Джессика изо всех сил выкрикнула это, она ударила по двери почетной гостевой комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica acertou a porta do quarto VIP enquanto berrava com toda a sua força.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香聲嘶力竭地高喊著，猛敲貴賓室的門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香声嘶力竭地高喊着，猛敲贵宾室的门。
Italian (IT): Gridando con tutta la sua forza, Jessica colpì la porta della sala VIP.
Turkish (TR): Jessica tüm gücüyle bağırarak VIP odasının kapısına vurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): It definitely wasn't a knock. ...That sound was the beating of her anger's hammer, whose message was clear: if the woman didn't open the door, she'd break it down.
Steam (ST): It definitely wasn't a knock. ...That sound was the beating of her anger's hammer, as if she was determined to break the door down if it wasn't opened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It definitely wasn't a knock....That sound was the beating of her anger's hammer, as though she was saying that if they didn't open the door, she'd break it down.
PC Japanese (JP): それは断じてノックではない。…開けぬなら打ち破ってやるという怒りの槌の打撲音だった。
Russian (RU): То определённо не был вежливый стук. ...Это был звук удара её молота гнева, словно она хотела сказать, что если ей не откроют дверь, то она разобьёт её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso definitivamente não era uma batida. ...Aquele som era a batida do martelo de sua raiva, cuja mensagem era clara: se a mulher não abrisse a porta, ela a quebraria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這斷然不能算作敲門聲。…而是“若不開，那就砸開這扇門”的憤怒鐵錘所發出的錘擊聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这断然不能算作敲门声。…而是“若不开，那就砸开这扇门”的愤怒铁锤所发出的锤击声。
Italian (IT): Non stava affatto bussando... Quello era il suono dell'impatto di un martello furente che avvertiva di aprire la porta, o altrimenti sarebbe stata sfondata.
Turkish (TR): Kesinlikle tıklama denilecek bir ses değildi. ...Bu ses öfkesinin çekicinin vuruşuydu, sanki açılmazsa kapıyı kırmaya kararlıydı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Open it, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Come out!! You hear me, right?! Open up!!!"
Steam (ST): "Open up, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Come out!! You hear me, right?! Open up!!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Open it, Beatrice!! Come out!! You hear me, right?! Open up!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「開けろよッ、ベアトリーチェ！！　出て来い！！　聞こえてるんだろう？！　ここを開けろッ！！！」
Russian (RU): "Открывай, {f:5:Беатриче}! Выходи! Ты слышишь меня, верно?! Открывай!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Abra, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Saia!! Você pode me ouvir, não pode?! Abra!!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「開門，貝阿朵莉切！！給我出來！！你有聽到吧？！快把門打開！！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「开门，贝阿朵莉切！！给我出来！！你有听到吧？！快把门打开！！！」
Italian (IT): "Apri, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Esci fuori!! Mi senti o no?! Apri la porta!!!"
Turkish (TR): "Aç şunu, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Çık dışarı!! Duyuyorsun, değil mi?! Aç kapıyı!!!"

Umineko Project (UP): There was no answer. ...Jessica twisted the doorknob without any reservation, but she felt the resistance of the lock.
Steam (ST): There was no answer. ...Jessica grabbed the doorknob without any reservation, but she felt the resistance of the lock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was no answer....Jessica grabbed the doorknob without any reservation, but she felt the resistance of the lock.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu sei que será rude se ela estiver aí. .........Mas, de qualquer forma, ...se a {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama não tiver nada a ver com isto, ela só tem que se explicar para que possamos acreditar nela."

Umineko Project (UP): However, there definitely were signs that the bed had been used, ......and although it's an odd way to say it, the atmosphere in the room had grown a little softer.
Steam (ST): However, there definitely were signs that the bed had been used... and though it was only a vague sense, the atmosphere in the room felt a little soft.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, definitivamente havia sinais de que a cama tinha sido usada, ......e apesar de ser um jeito estranho de dizer isso, a atmosfera no quarto tinha ficado um pouco mais suave.

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't the hard atmosphere of a place normally devoid of people, like the chapel.{n}You could definitely tell that someone had spent the night in this room.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 實際上，朱志香和鄉田都還沒有見過貝阿朵莉切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 实际上，朱志香和乡田都还没有见过贝阿朵莉切。
Italian (IT): Ad onor del vero, sia Jessica che Gouda non avevano ancora incontrato {f:5:Beatrice}.
Turkish (TR): Gerçekte, ne Jessica ne de Gohda henüz {f:5:Beatrice} ile karşılaşmamıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...They had only been told by those who had met her that she was the spitting image of the person in the portrait.
Steam (ST): ...They had only been told by those who had met her that she looked like a double of the character in that portrait.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...They had only been told by those who had met her that she looked like a double of the character in that portrait.
PC Japanese (JP): …肖像画に瓜二つの人物だと会った人間たちに聞かされただけだ。
Russian (RU): ...Они лишь знали от тех, кто встретил её, что она была похожа как две капли воды на ведьму с портрета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eles apenas tinham ouvido falar, por meio daqueles que tinham encontrado a bruxa, que ela era a imagem exata da pessoa no retrato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …只是聽見過的人說過，有這麼一位與肖像畫中魔女一模一樣的人而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …只是听见过的人说过，有这么一位与肖像画中魔女一模一样的人而已。
Italian (IT): Avevano solo sentito da quelli che si erano imbattuti in lei che era una copia sputata del soggetto del ritratto...
Turkish (TR): ...Sadece onunla karşılaşanlardan, portredeki kişinin tıpatıp aynısı olduğunu duymuşlardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...So they were doubtful about what her face really looked like.
Steam (ST): ...So, they were doubtful about what her face really looked like.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …だから、実際はどんな顔をしているのだろうと訝しがっていた。
Russian (RU): ...Поэтому они сомневались в том, как на самом деле она выглядит.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por isso, eles tinham dúvidas quanto à verdadeira aparência de seu rosto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …所以，他們都對她實際長什麼樣，充滿了疑問。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …所以，他们都对她实际长什么样，充满了疑问。
Italian (IT): Perciò, non erano certi su come fosse veramente la sua faccia...
Turkish (TR): ...Bu yüzden, yüzünün gerçekte neye benzediği konusunda şüpheleri vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, Kanon alone had met her. And he understood what kind of being that witch was, ......and what kind of character she had.
Steam (ST): ...However, Kanon alone had met her. He understood what kind of being that witch was, ...what kind of personality she had.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、嘉音だけは会っている。そしてあの魔女がどういう存在で、……どんな性分なのかを理解している。
Russian (RU): ...Впрочем, знаком с ней был именно Канон. И он знал, что это была за ведьма и каким она обладала характером.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porém, Kanon sozinho tinha encontrado‐a. E ele entendia que tipo de ser aquela bruxa era, ......e que tipo de caráter ela tinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，唯有嘉音是親眼見過的。並且清楚那魔女究竟是怎樣的存在，……是怎樣的性情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，唯有嘉音是亲眼见过的。并且清楚那魔女究竟是怎样的存在，……是怎样的性情。
Italian (IT): Ma Kanon era il solo ad averla incrociata. Sapeva che tipo di entità fosse la strega... e come fosse la sua personalità.
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak, Kanon onunla karşılaşmıştı. Ve o cadının nasıl bir varlık olduğunu, ......nasıl bir karaktere sahip olduğunu anlamıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): So he knew that if they were to force their way in here searching for her, she wouldn't let things go as they planned.
Steam (ST): So, he knew that forcing their way in here in search for her...definitely wouldn't work out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So he knew that if they were to force their way in here searching for her, she wouldn't let things go as they planned.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、自分たちが彼女の姿を求めてここへ押しかけたなら、絶対、思い通りになどさせるわけがないのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому он понимал, что раз им пришлось пробиться сюда в её поисках, она не позволит произойти тому, что они могли задумать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ele sabia que se fossem forçar seu caminho aqui procurando por ela, a bruxa não deixaria as coisas andarem como eles planejavam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，他們若是為了找她而闖進了此處，那她是絕對不會讓他們稱心如意的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，他们若是为了找她而闯进了此处，那她是绝对不会让他们称心如意的。
Italian (IT): Pertanto, se avevano fatto irruzione lì per cercarla, era garantito che le cose non sarebbero andate come si voleva.
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden, onu bulmak için buraya zorla girecek olurlarsa, işlerin planladıkları gibi gitmesine izin vermeyeceğini biliyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......She must be watching us bitterly flail about in vain from somewhere, sneering at us. ......She's that kind of person.
Steam (ST): ...She must be watching us bitterly flail about in vain from somewhere, sneering at us. ...She's that kind of person.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She must be watching us bitterly flail about in vain from somewhere, sneering at us.......She's that kind of person.
PC Japanese (JP): ……空振りさせ、悔しがる自分たちをどこかで見ていて、嘲笑っているに決まっている。……あいつはそういうヤツなのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Она должно быть наблюдает, как мы, одержимые горем, впустую мечемся, насмехаясь над нами. ......Такой она человек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela devia estar nos assistindo falhar amargamente em uma busca vã, zombando de nós. ......É esse tipo de pessoa que ela é.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……魔女肯定是讓他們白跑了一趟，還在某處嘲笑著，懊惱不已的他們幾人。……她就是這樣的傢伙。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……魔女肯定是让他们白跑了一趟，还在某处嘲笑着，懊恼不已的他们几人。……她就是这样的家伙。
Italian (IT): Sicuramente stava osservando da qualche parte i loro sforzi inutili, prendendosi gioco della loro frustrazione... Lei era quel tipo di persona.
Turkish (TR): ......Bir yerlerden boş yere çırpınışımızı izliyor ve bizimle alay ediyor olmalı. ......İşte o öyle biri.

Umineko Project (UP): Because he was looking at things that way, Kanon was the first to find it. ...The other two were concentrating on finding the shape of a person, so they hadn't noticed.
Steam (ST): Because he was looking at things that way, Kanon was the first to find it. ...The other two were concentrating on finding the shadow of a person, so they didn't notice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because he was looking at things that way, Kanon was the first to find it....The other two were concentrating on finding the shadow of a person, so they hadn't noticed.
PC Japanese (JP): そういう目で見ていたから、嘉音が一番最初に見つけられた。…他の二人は人影を探すことに集中していたから気付けなかったのだ。
Russian (RU): Из‐за такого взгляда на вещи, Канон был первым, кто обнаружил это. ..Двое других были заняты поиском тени той личности, поэтому не обратили внимания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque ele estava olhando para as coisas daquele jeito, Kanon foi o primeiro a encontrá‐la. ...Os outros dois estavam se concentrando em encontrar o formato de uma pessoa, por isso não haviam percebido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正因為嘉音心中抱有著這樣的看法，所以他第一個發現了。…其他兩人由於光是在集中精神找人，因而沒能注意到它。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正因为嘉音心中抱有着这样的看法，所以他第一个发现了。…其他两人由于光是在集中精神找人，因而没能注意到它。
Italian (IT): Esaminando la situazione da quella prospettiva, Kanon fu il primo a trovarlo... Dato che gli altri due si stavano concentrando per trovare la sagoma di una persona, non ci avevano fatto caso.
Turkish (TR): Olaylara bu açıdan baktığı için, bir şey bulan ilk Kanon oldu. ...Diğer ikisi bir insan figürü bulmaya odaklandıkları için fark etmemişlerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): Near a water jug on the side table, there was a single sheet of writing paper. It was accompanied by a short message and a fountain pen which had probably been used to write it...
Steam (ST): Near a water jug on the side table, there was a single sheet of letter paper. On it was a short message, and nearby was a fountain pen, which had probably been used to write it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Near a water jug on the side table, there was a single sheet of writing paper. It was accompanied by a short message and a fountain pen which had probably been used to write it...
PC Japanese (JP): サイドテーブルの上の水差しの脇に、便箋が一枚置かれていた。短いメッセージと、それを書いたのだろう万年筆が添えられている…。
Russian (RU): Около кувшина с водой на приставном столике лежал лист писчей бумаги. На нём было написано короткое сообщение, а рядом лежала авторучка, которой, вероятно, оно и было написано...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Próximo de uma jarra de água na escrivaninha, havia uma única folha de papel de carta. Ela estava acompanhada por uma curta mensagem e uma caneta tinteiro, a qual provavelmente tinha sido usada para escrevê‐la...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在方桌上的水壺邊，擺放著一張信紙。上面附著短短的幾行字，還放著一支寫下這些的鋼筆…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在方桌上的水壶边，摆放着一张信纸。上面附着短短的几行字，还放着一支写下这些的钢笔…。
Italian (IT): Accanto ad una brocca posta su un tavolino, c'era un foglio di carta da lettere. C'era un breve messaggio, insieme ad una stilografica che probabilmente era stata usata per scriverlo...
Turkish (TR): Yan masadaki su sürahisinin yanında duran bir kâğıt vardı. Kağıda, üzerindeki kısa mesaj ve muhtemelen bu mesajı yazmak için kullanılmış olan dolmakalem eşlik ediyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon understood the witch. The witch would definitely ridicule them, as they found the six corpses, forced their way in here in rage, and were unable to find her.
Steam (ST): Kanon had already come to understand the witch. After finding the corpses, they'd been overcome by rage and barged in here, only to find no one, so of course the witch would mock them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon understood the witch. The witch would definitely scoff at them, as they found the bodies, forced their way in here in rage, and were unable to find her.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は魔女を理解していた。６人の死体を見つけて、怒りに駆られてここへ押し掛け、姿を見つけられない自分たちを、必ず魔女は嘲る。
Russian (RU): Канон понял ведьму. Ведьма несомненно издевалась над ними, ведь они обнаружили тела, в ярости ворвались сюда и не смогли её найти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon entendia a bruxa. Depois de terem encontrado os cadáveres, eles haviam sido tomados pela fúria e apressaram‐se até aqui, apenas para não encontrarem ninguém, em vista disso, era certo que a bruxa zombaria deles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音理解了魔女的意思。他們發現了六人的屍體，被憤怒所驅使而闖進了此處，卻找不到半個人影。魔女必然會對這樣的他們抱以嘲諷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音理解了魔女的意思。他们发现了六人的尸体，被愤怒所驱使而闯进了此处，却找不到半个人影。魔女必然会对这样的他们抱以嘲讽。
Italian (IT): Kanon aveva compreso le intenzioni della strega. Dopo aver scoperto i sei cadaveri, erano stati sopraffatti dalla rabbia ed erano entrati di prepotenza, per poi non trovare nessuno, e la strega si stava prendendo gioco di ciò...
Turkish (TR): Kanon cadıyı anlamıştı. Altı cesedi buldukları, öfke içinde bu odaya zorla girdikleri ve onu bulamadıkları için cadı kesinlikle onlarla alay edecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Ridicule has no meaning unless it is communicated.{n}So in other words, ...this was definitely...that...!
Steam (ST): ...You can't mock someone unless they know they're being mocked. So, in other words, ...that's what this must be...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Scorn cannot be fulfilled unless it is communicated. So in other words, ...this was definitely, that...!
PC Japanese (JP): ……嘲りは、それを伝えなければ成立しない。だからつまり、…これはきっと、それ…！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……嘲りは、それを伝えなければ成立しない。{n}だからつまり、…これはきっと、それ…！
Russian (RU): ......Невозможно выразить презрение, если не сообщить о нём.{n}Поэтому, другими словами... это определённо было то самое!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O escárnio não tem significado a menos que seja comunicado.{n}Por isso, em outras palavras, ...isto definitivamente era...aquilo...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而嘲諷，若不讓受嘲之人明白，那就不算是嘲諷。{n}也就是說，…這一定就是，那個了…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而嘲讽，若不让受嘲之人明白，那就不算是嘲讽。{n}也就是说，…这一定就是，那个了…！
Italian (IT): Non si può manifestare il disprezzo senza comunicarlo.{n}Per cui, in altre parole... era di sicuro per quello...!
Turkish (TR): ......Alay, kişiye iletilmediği sürece bir anlamı yoktur.{n}Yani dolayısıyla, ...bu kesinlikle...oydu...!

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "......Milady. .........There's something written here."
Steam (ST): "...Milady, ......there's something written here."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お嬢様。………ここに何か書かれています。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お嬢様。………ここに何か書かれています」
Russian (RU): "......Миледи. .........Здесь что‐то написано."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ojou‐sama. .........Tem algo escrito aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……小姐。………這上面寫了些內容。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……小姐。………这上面写了些内容。」
Italian (IT): "...Signorina... Qui c'è scritto qualcosa."
Turkish (TR): "......Leydim. .........Buraya bir şey yazılmış."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Written, what?!"
Steam (ST): "Something written? What?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Written, what is it?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「書かれてるって、何だ？！」
Russian (RU): "Написано, что там?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Algo escrito, o quê?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「寫了內容？是什麼？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「写了内容？是什么？！」
Italian (IT): "Scritto qualcosa, hai detto?"
Turkish (TR): "Yazılmış mı, ne?!"

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica quickly dashed over and violently stole the piece of paper.
Steam (ST): Jessica dashed over and violently snatched the piece of paper away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After Jessica quickly dashed over, she violently stole the piece of paper.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香はズカズカと早足にやって来ると、便箋を乱暴に奪った。
Russian (RU): Джессика резко подбежала и яростно схватила лист бумаги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica rapidamente correu até ali e violentamente puxou o pedaço de papel.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香氣衝衝地快步走來，粗暴地奪走了信紙。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香气冲冲地快步走来，粗暴地夺走了信纸。
Italian (IT): Jessica si diresse subito verso di lui, e afferrò la carta da lettere in malo modo.
Turkish (TR): Jessica hızla yanına koştu ve kağıt parçasını sert bir şekilde kaptı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......She probably wasn't trying to be violent.{n}...She just couldn't control her strength now.
Steam (ST): ...She probably wasn't trying to be violent. ...She just couldn't control her strength right now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She probably wasn't trying to be violent....She just couldn't control her strength now.
PC Japanese (JP): ……本人に乱暴なつもりはないのだろう。…今は力の加減ができないだけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……本人に乱暴なつもりはないのだろう。{n}…今は力の加減ができないだけだ。
Russian (RU): ......Она не хотела показаться грубой.{n}...Просто в этот момент она не могла себя сдерживать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela provavelmente não estava tentando ser violenta.{n}...Ela só não conseguia mais controlar a sua força agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……她本人應該並沒有對嘉音動粗的意思。{n}…只是現在無法控制住力道而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……她本人应该并没有对嘉音动粗的意思。{n}…只是现在无法控制住力道而已。
Italian (IT): Probabilmente non intendeva essere manesca...{n}Era solo che in quel momento non riusciva a dosare la sua forza.
Turkish (TR): ......Muhtemelen saldırgan olmaya çalışmıyordu.{n}...Sadece, şu anda gücünü kontrol edemiyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): ".........What...?! She's, she's {i:mocking} me?!!"
Steam (ST): "......What the...?! D-Don't fuck with me!!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........What the...?! D, don't fuck with me!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………何だとぉ…？！　な、舐めやがってッ！！！」
Russian (RU): ".........Что это?! Н‐не смей шутить со мной!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........O quê...?! E‐Ela está tirando uma com a minha cara?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………什麼——…？！你、你他媽的少小瞧人！！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………什么——…？！你、你他妈的少小瞧人！！！」
Italian (IT): "...Che cosa...?! M-Mi sta {i:perculando}!!"
Turkish (TR): ".........Ne dedin...?! B-Benimle {i:alay} mı ediyor?!!"

Umineko Project (UP): As soon as she read the message, Jessica went into a wild rage, crumpled the paper up, and threw it.
Steam (ST): As soon as she read the message, Jessica went into a wild rage, crumpled the paper up, and threw it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): メッセージを読んだ途端、朱志香は激しく怒り狂い、便箋をぐしゃぐしゃに丸めて叩きつける。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): メッセージを読んだ途端、朱志香は激しく怒り、便箋をぐしゃぐしゃに丸めて叩きつける。
Russian (RU): Как только она прочла сообщение, Джессика пришла в неописуемую ярость, скомкала бумагу, и выбросила её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que leu a mensagem, Jessica entrou em uma fúria selvagem, amassou o papel, e o jogou longe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛讀完信紙上的字，朱志香就在激怒之下把信紙揉成團，狠狠地扔在了地上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚读完信纸上的字，朱志香就在激怒之下把信纸揉成团，狠狠地扔在了地上。
Italian (IT): Non appena lesse il messaggio, Jessica si infuriò come non mai, per poi accartocciare il foglio e scagliarlo via.
Turkish (TR): Mesajı okur okumaz Jessica çılgınca bir öfkeye kapıldı, kağıdı buruşturdu ve fırlattı.

Umineko Project (UP): Then, she grabbed a table lamp that was by the side of the bed and violently swung it around, mercilessly hitting the walls and furniture with it.
Steam (ST): Then, she grabbed a light stand by the bedside and violently swung it around, mercilessly hitting the walls and furniture with it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, she grabbed an interior stand by the bedside and violently swung it around, mercilessly hitting the walls and furniture with it.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、ベッドサイドにあったインテリアスタンドを掴むと、それを乱暴に振り回して、それを壁や家具にひたすら叩き付けた。
Russian (RU): Затем, затем она схватила декоративный светильник, стоявший у кровати, и яростно замахала им вокруг, нещадно задевая им стены и мебель.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ela agarrou um abajur que estava ao lado da cama e violentamente o balançou ao redor, impiedosamente acertando as paredes e os móveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，她抓起放在床邊的室內台燈，四處亂舞，一個勁地把它砸向牆壁和家具。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，她抓起放在床边的室内台灯，四处乱舞，一个劲地把它砸向墙壁和家具。
Italian (IT): Dopodiché, prese una lampada da interni vicina al letto e la agitò all'impazzata, colpendo senza ritegno muri e mobili...
Turkish (TR): Sonra yatağın yanında duran bir masa lambasını kaptığı gibi şiddetle savurarak duvarlara ve mobilyalara acımasızca vurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...The lightbulb shattered at once, and scattered its shards across the room.
Steam (ST): ...The lightbulbs all shattered at once, and the fragments were scattered across the room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The lightbulbs all shattered at once, and the fragments were scattered across the room.
PC Japanese (JP): …たちまち電球が破裂しその破片を辺りにばら撒いた。
Russian (RU): ...Все лампочки тут же побились и осколки разлетелись по всей комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...A lâmpada se despedaçou de uma vez, espalhando seus cacos pelo quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …轉眼間燈泡破裂，碎片四處飛濺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …转眼间灯泡破裂，碎片四处飞溅。
Italian (IT): La lampadina si frantumò in men che non si dica, sparpagliando schegge nei dintorni.
Turkish (TR): ...Ampul bir anda paramparça olarak parçaları odanın dört bir yanına saçıldı.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:―Did you think I'd waste my time waiting comfortably in this place for you to barge in here?{n} You're too wild to be suitable for this intellectual night.{n} What kind of faces must your parents have had after raising you to be such a hapless fool?{n} Yeah, I saw them, they had perfectly stupid faces just like you.{n} Now they are in Candyland with their bellies all full!}
Steam (ST): {e:070:'Did you think I'd be that senile, to just sit around here waiting for you to come barging in? {n}You're way too inelegant for this intellectual night. {n}I can only imagine what the parents who raised you to be such a moron must've looked like. {n}Oh right, I saw them, and they looked just as moronic as you. {n}Now, their bellies are full in the land of sweets!'}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 'Do you think I'd be that senile, to wait comfortably in this place for you to barge in here?{n} You're too wild to be suitable for this intellectual night.{n} What kind of faces did your parents, who raised you to be so stupid, make? {n}Yeah, I saw them, they had a truly stupid look just like you.{n} Now, their bellies are full in the land of sweets!'
PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:“私がぬくぬくとここで、貴方が飛び込んでくるのを待ち呆けるとでも？{n}　知的な夜に、粗暴なる貴方は似合わない。{n}こんな間抜けに育てた親はどんな顔？{n}うん、見たよ、本当にそっくりな間抜け面。{n}今はお菓子の国でお腹いっぱい！”}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {e:070:“私がぬくぬくとここで、貴方が飛び込んでくるのを待ち呆けるとでも？{n}知的な夜に、粗暴なる貴方は似合わない。{n}こんな間抜けに育てた親はどんな顔？{n}うん、見たよ、本当にそっくりな間抜け面。{n}今はお菓子の国でお腹いっぱい！”}
Russian (RU): {e:070:'Ты думала, я буду просто сидеть, как дура и ждать, пока ты вломишься?{n} Такая дикарка не подходит для этой интеллектуальной ночи.{n}Знаешь, какое выражение было у твоих родителей, вырастивших такую недалёкую дочку?{n}А вот я видела, и их лица выглядели ужасно глупо, как и у тебя.{n}И теперь их животы набиты сладостями!'}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:―Achou que eu ficaria esperando confortavelmente você vir até este lugar?{n} Seus modos são muito deselegantes para esta noite intelectual.{n} Que tipo de rostos seus pais devem ter feito depois de a criarem para ser uma tola desgraçada?{n} Sim, eu os vi, e eles tinham rostos perfeitamente estúpidos assim como você.{n} Agora eles estão na Terra dos Doces, com suas barrigas cheias!}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:“你以為我會糊塗到滿不在乎地在這裡等你殺來？{n}充滿知性的夜晚並不適合粗暴的你。{n}養出此等蠢蛋的父母會是一副怎樣的長相啊？{n}嗯，看過了，真是副一個模子刻出來的蠢臉呢。{n}現在他們已經在點心國裡，填飽了肚子！”}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:“你以为我会糊涂到满不在乎地在这里等你杀来？{n}充满知性的夜晚并不适合粗暴的你。{n}养出此等蠢蛋的父母会是一副怎样的长相啊？{n}嗯，看过了，真是副一个模子刻出来的蠢脸呢。{n}现在他们已经在点心国里，填饱了肚子！”}
Italian (IT): {e:070:―Mi credi così sciocca da starmene qui ad aspettare in tutta comodità la tua intrusione?{n} La tua aggressività non si addice a questa serata intellettuale.{n} Che tipo di facce dovevano avere i tuoi genitori per crescere una tale testa di rapa?{n} Sì, le ho viste, avevano un'espressione da vere teste di rapa, esattamente come la tua.{n} Adesso loro sono con la pancia piena a Dolcilandia!}

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica cried very, very hard. ...Because if she didn't, her rage would start building up again, and swallow her up.
Steam (ST): Jessica cried very, very hard. ...Because if she didn't, her rage would start building up again and swallow her up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica cried very, very hard....Because if she didn't, her rage would start building up again, and swallow her up.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は強く強く、涙を流す。…でないと、再び怒りが込み上げてきて、自分を飲み込んでしまいそうだから。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Gohda was a veteran with many years behind him. He had seen a great number of people in his life. ...So he knew of the vigorous sparkle that could be found in the eyes of those who had self‐control.
Steam (ST): ...Gohda was a veteran with many years behind him. He'd seen a great number of people in his life. ...So he knew the vigorous sparkle that could be found in the eyes of those who possessed self-control.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Gohda was a veteran with many years behind him. He had seen a great number of people in his life....So he knew of the vigorous sparkle that could be found in the eyes of those who had self-control.
PC Japanese (JP): …郷田も長い年季を持つベテランだ。大勢の人間を見てきた。…だから、克己した人間の目に浮かぶ力強い輝きを知っていた。
Russian (RU): ...Года был ветераном со многими годами за плечами. Он повидал великое множество людей в своей жизни. ...Поэтому ему был знаком этот энергичный блеск, который можно было увидеть в глазах у тех, кто обладал достаточным самообладанием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Gohda era um veterano com muitos anos nas costas. Ele conheceu um grande número de pessoas durante sua vida. ...Por isso, ele sabia do brilho vigoroso que podia ser encontrado nos olhos daqueles que tinham autocontrole.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …鄉田也是位有長年工作經驗的老手。閱人無數。…所以，他很清楚那會在克己之人眼中浮現的強勁光輝。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …乡田也是位有长年工作经验的老手。阅人无数。…所以，他很清楚那会在克己之人眼中浮现的强劲光辉。
Italian (IT): Gouda era un veterano con molti anni di esperienza alle spalle. Si era trovato di fronte a diverse tipologie di persone... Perciò conosceva la scintilla di determinazione che brillava negli occhi di coloro che possedevano autodisciplina.
Turkish (TR): ...Gohda, arkasında uzun yıllar bırakmış, tecrübeli biriydi. Hayatı boyunca çok sayıda insan görmüştü. ...Bu yüzden, kendini kontrol edebilenlerin gözlerinde bulunan güçlü ışıltıyı biliyordu.

Steam (ST): Jessica, still suffering from her asthma, ...seemed to be heading towards her room, though she kept leaning against the wall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Jessica suffered from her asthma, ...it seemed she was heading towards her room, leaning against the wall.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は喘息に苦しみながら、…壁にもたれかかりつつも、自分の部屋に向かっているようだった。
Russian (RU): Видимо Джессику измучила астма... Судя по всему, она направлялась в свою комнату, прислонившись к стене.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que Jessica estava seguindo em direção ao próprio quarto, ...encostada contra a parede enquanto sofria com sua asma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香痛苦地哮喘著，…看起來是在靠著牆壁緩慢地朝自己的房間走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香痛苦地哮喘着，…看起来是在靠着墙壁缓慢地朝自己的房间走去。
Italian (IT): Jessica, che pativa il suo asma... sembrava dirigersi verso la sua stanza, sostenendosi contro la parete...
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre Jessica astımının etkisiyle duvara yaslanmış bir vaziyette, ...odasına doğru ilerliyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Kanon followed after her wordlessly.
Steam (ST): ...Kanon followed her wordlessly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Kanon chased after her wordlessly.
PC Japanese (JP): ……嘉音は無言でその後を追う。
Russian (RU): ......Канон безмолвно последовал за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Kanon seguiu atrás dela sem palavras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……嘉音沉默不語地緊隨其後。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……嘉音沉默不语地紧随其后。
Italian (IT): Kanon la seguì senza proferire parola.
Turkish (TR): ......Kanon hiç konuşmadan onu takip etti.

Umineko Project (UP): If she had asked for a hand, he would have jumped over and supported her. ...But as long as Jessica didn't ask for that, he hid himself, watching over her from a distance where he could come to her rescue at any time.
Steam (ST): If she had asked for a hand, he would have leapt forward and supported her. ...But until Jessica did ask for that, he chose to hide himself, watching over her from a distance where he could come to her rescue at any time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If she had asked for a hand, he would have jumped over and supported her....But as long as Jessica didn't ask for that, he hid himself, watching over her from a distance where he could come to her rescue at any time.
PC Japanese (JP): 手を貸せといわれれば、飛んでいって支える。…しかし朱志香がそれを求めない限り気配を殺し、いつでも助けられる距離にいて、彼女を見守った。
Russian (RU): Если бы она попросила руку, он бы подбежал и помог ей. ...Но пока Джессика не попросила об этом, он скрывал себя, наблюдая за ней на расстоянии, откуда смог бы прийти к ней на помощь в любой момент.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ela tivesse pedido por uma mão, ele teria saltado até ela e a apoiado. ...Mas como Jessica não pediu por isso, ele se escondeu, observando‐a de uma distância onde ele poderia resgatá‐la a qualquer momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是朱志香叫他去幫忙，他就會飛奔上去攙扶她。…可是，只要朱志香不開口求助，他就只會壓低自己的氣息，與之保持隨時都能上前幫助的距離，守護著她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是朱志香叫他去帮忙，他就会飞奔上去搀扶她。…可是，只要朱志香不开口求助，他就只会压低自己的气息，与之保持随时都能上前帮助的距离，守护着她。
Italian (IT): Se gli avesse chiesto una mano, sarebbe corso ad aiutarla... Ma finché Jessica non glielo avesse chiesto, avrebbe nascosto le sue tracce, vigilando su di lei da una distanza da cui avrebbe sempre potuto accorrere in suo aiuto...
Turkish (TR): Eğer yardım isteseydi, hemen atlar ve ona destek olurdu. ...Ama Jessica bunu istemediği sürece kendini gizledi ve onu her an kurtarmaya yetişebileceği bir mesafeden izledi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......As Kanon remained in that spot where ten billion people would hope for someone else to be when their hearts felt like they would explode from sadness, he silently watched Jessica's back...
Steam (ST): ...When people feel their hearts are about to explode from sadness and want to have someone by their sides, you can bet ten billion of them would want to turn around and find someone in the place Kanon now stood, as he watched over Jessica from behind...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......As Kanon remained in that spot where ten billion people would want someone else to be when their hearts felt like they would explode from sadness, he silently watched Jessica's back...
PC Japanese (JP): ……心が張り裂けそうなほど悲しい時、誰かがそこにいてくれたらと、百億の人々が振り返る時、居て欲しい場所に嘉音はいながら朱志香の背中を無言で見守った…。
Russian (RU): ......Оставаясь в месте, которое десять миллиардов людей не колеблясь отдали бы другому, чтобы их сердца не рвала на куски печаль, Канон молча смотрел в спину Джессики...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Enquanto Kanon permaneceu naquele local onde dez bilhões de pessoas esperariam que alguém estivesse quando seus corações parecessem que explodiriam de tristeza, ele silenciosamente vigiou as costas de Jessica...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……撕心裂肺般悲傷時，任誰都會期望著有他人在身旁。而嘉音，就待在了千千萬萬人回首之時，都希望有人在的那個地方，從背後默默地守護著朱志香…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……撕心裂肺般悲伤时，任谁都会期望着有他人在身旁。而嘉音，就待在了千千万万人回首之时，都希望有人在的那个地方，从背后默默地守护着朱志香…。
Italian (IT): Stanziando nel luogo in cui milioni di miliardi di persone, dal cuore sul punto di scoppiare per lo sconforto, avrebbero voluto avere qualcuno lì presente nel momento in cui si sarebbero girate con la testa, Kanon copriva silenziosamente le spalle di Jessica...
Turkish (TR): ......Kanon, on milyar insanın kalpleri üzüntüden patlayacakmış gibi hissettiğinde başka birinin olmasını umacağı o an, sessizce Jessica'nın arkasından onu izledi...

Umineko Project (UP): Then, finally, she was crouching in front of the door to her own room.
Steam (ST): Then, finally, she doubled over in front of the door to her room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, finally, she was crouching in front of the door to her own room.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてとうとう、自分の部屋の扉の前でうずくまってしまう。
Russian (RU): И наконец, она присела перед дверью в свою комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, finalmente, ela estava se agachando na frente da porta do seu próprio quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 終於，朱志香還是在自己房間的門前蹲倒了下來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 终于，朱志香还是在自己房间的门前蹲倒了下来。
Italian (IT): E alla fine del suo percorso, lei si rannicchiò di fronte alla porta della propria stanza...
Turkish (TR): Sonunda, Jessica kendi odasının kapısının önünde çömelip kalmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......The asthma attack had stolen all of her strength. And her thoughts had gotten hazy from the lack of oxygen, so that she could no longer stand up.
Steam (ST): ...The asthma attack had stolen all her strength. And her thoughts had gotten hazy from the lack of oxygen, making it impossible even to stand up again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……喘息の発作は、全身の体力を奪う。そして酸欠になった頭は朦朧とし、もはや立ち上がることもできないのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Астма лишила её всех сил. И из‐за недостатка кислорода её мысли совсем затуманились, так что она даже была не в состоянии подняться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O ataque de asma tinha roubado todas as suas forças. Seus pensamentos estavam nebulosos pela falta de oxigênio, tanto que ela não conseguia mais ficar de pé.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……哮喘的發作，奪走了她全身的體力。而且由於大腦缺氧意識模糊，她已經連站都站不起來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……哮喘的发作，夺走了她全身的体力。而且由于大脑缺氧意识模糊，她已经连站都站不起来了。
Italian (IT): L'attacco d'asma l'aveva privata di tutte le sue forze. Inoltre, i suoi pensieri erano offuscati dalla mancanza di ossigeno, e non riusciva più a reggersi in piedi...
Turkish (TR): ......Astım krizi tüm gücünü tüketmişti. Ve oksijensizlik yüzünden düşünceleri bulanıklaşmıştı, öyle ki artık ayağa bile kalkamıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......But right now, Jessica wasn't thinking that she wanted someone to lend a hand. Because she still hadn't been able to overcome the flames of anger.
Steam (ST): ...But right then, Jessica didn't think she wanted someone to lend a hand. She still hadn't been able to overcome the flames of anger.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも、今の朱志香は誰かに手を貸されたいとは思っていない。なぜなら、怒りの炎にまだ打ち勝てなかったから。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……でも、今の朱志香は誰かに手を貸されたいとは思っていない。なぜなら、怒りの炎にまだ打ち勝てていなかったから。
Russian (RU): ......Но в этот момент Джессика даже не думала о том, чтобы попросить у кого‐нибудь руку. Поскольку она всё ещё не смогла подавить собственный гнев.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas, mesmo agora, Jessica não estava pensando que ela queria que alguém lhe desse uma mão. Porque ela ainda não tinha sido capaz de superar as chamas da raiva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，現在的朱志香並不希望有人向她伸出援手。而這是因為，她還沒有戰勝憤怒的烈火。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，现在的朱志香并不希望有人向她伸出援手。而这是因为，她还没有战胜愤怒的烈火。
Italian (IT): Ma in quel momento, Jessica non stava pensando di volere qualcuno che la aiutasse. Perché non era ancora riuscita a prevalere sulle fiamme della propria rabbia...
Turkish (TR): ......Ama şu anda, Jessica birinin ona yardım etmesini istemiyordu. Çünkü hâlâ öfke alevlerinin üstesinden gelememişti.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Because even if someone had offered her a hand with good intentions, right now, Jessica would start wanting to grab it and lacerate it.
Steam (ST): ...Even if someone had offered her a hand with good intentions, Jessica would've wanted to tear it off right then.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Because even if someone had offered her a hand with good intentions, right now, Jessica would start wanting to tear it off.
PC Japanese (JP): …もし、差し伸べてくれる手が善意であっても、今の朱志香はその手を掴み引き裂いてしまいたくなるだろうから。
Russian (RU): ...Поэтому даже если кто‐нибудь с добрыми намерениями и протянул бы ей сейчас руку, Джессике бы захотелось просто оторвать её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porque, mesmo se alguém tivesse oferecido uma mão a ela com boas intenções, naquele momento, Jessica iria querer agarrá‐la e dilacerá‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …是因為，即便伸來的援手帶有著善意，如今的朱志香，可能也會涌起一股想要抓過它來、將它扯斷的衝動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …是因为，即便伸来的援手带有着善意，如今的朱志香，可能也会涌起一股想要抓过它来、将它扯断的冲动。
Italian (IT): Perciò, anche se le fosse stata offerta una mano con buone intenzioni, Jessica l'avrebbe voluta afferrare solamente per poi strapparla via...
Turkish (TR): ...Çünkü biri ona iyi niyetle elini uzatsa bile, şu anda Jessica o eli tutup kırmak isteyecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): ...And she understood how unreasonable that would be. ...Until she could overcome the flames of her anger, she definitely wouldn't ask for help.
Steam (ST): ...She knew how unfair that would be. ...So she definitely wouldn't ask for help until she overcame the fiery anger burning inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And she understood how unreasonable that would be....Until she could overcome the flames of her anger, she definitely wouldn't ask for help.
PC Japanese (JP): …そしてそれがあまりに理不尽なことだと理解していたから。…怒りの炎に打ち勝てるまで、彼女は決して助けを求めなかった。
Russian (RU): ...И она осознавала, как неразумно это было. ...Пока она не сможет погасить пламя своего гнева, она точно не станет просить о помощи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E ela entendia o quão irracional isso seria. ...Até que conseguisse superar as chamas da raiva, ela definitivamente não chamaria por ajuda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …並且，正因為她清楚這份衝動實在是過於蠻橫無理。…所以在戰勝憤怒的烈火前，她絲毫沒有尋求過幫助。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …并且，正因为她清楚这份冲动实在是过于蛮横无理。…所以在战胜愤怒的烈火前，她丝毫没有寻求过帮助。
Italian (IT): E dato che comprendeva quanto fossero irrazionali questi suoi pensieri... lei non avrebbe mai e poi mai chiesto aiuto, non finché non avrebbe placato le fiamme della propria ira.
Turkish (TR): ...Ve bunun ne kadar mantık dışı olduğunun farkındaydı. ...Öfkesinin alevlerinin üstesinden gelene dek kesinlikle yardım istemeyecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): Probably, Jessica no longer even had the willpower to call for help.
Steam (ST): Jessica had probably lost the willpower even to call for help.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Probably, Jessica no longer had the willpower to call for help.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香はもはや助けを口にする気力もなかったろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 朱志香はもはや助けを口にする気力もなかっただろう。
Russian (RU): Возможно, у Джессики просто не оставалось сил, чтобы позвать на помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente, Jessica nem tinha mais a força de vontade para chamar por ajuda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香已是連開口求助的精力都沒有了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香已是连开口求助的精力都没有了吧。
Italian (IT): Probabilmente, Jessica non aveva più le energie per chiedere aiuto...
Turkish (TR): Muhtemelen, Jessica artık yardım isteyecek iradeye bile sahip değildi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......But Kanon heard it. ...He definitely heard it.
Steam (ST): ...But Kanon heard it. ...He definitely heard it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But Kanon heard it....He definitely heard it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも、嘉音は聞いた。…確かに聞いた。
Russian (RU): ......Но Канон слышал её. ...Он точно слышал её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas Kanon ouviu. ...Ele definitivamente ouviu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，嘉音聽到了。…確確實實地聽到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，嘉音听到了。…确确实实地听到了。
Italian (IT): Ma Kanon l'aveva sentita... L'aveva sentita senz'altro...
Turkish (TR): ......Ama Kanon duydu. ...Kesinlikle duydu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Kanon definitely heard that voiceless call for help, which is shared by those from across the world who are grieving, and which, though they scream and scream, cannot be heard by anyone.
Steam (ST): ...Kanon definitely heard that voiceless call for help, one shared by miserable grievers the world round, ...an endless scream that no one ever seems to hear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Kanon definitely heard that voiceless call for help, which is shared by those from across the world who are grieving, and which cannot be heard by anyone even though they scream and scream.
PC Japanese (JP): ……世界中で悲哀に嘆く人々が、なぜこれほどに叫んでいるのに誰も聞こえてくれないのかと嘆くその声なき助けを、確かに嘉音は聞いた。
Russian (RU): ......Канон определённо слышал ту немую просьбу о помощи, которую разделяли во всём мире те, кто пребывали в горе, и которых не было слышно, даже несмотря на все их крики.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Kanon definitivamente ouviu esse silencioso pedido de ajuda, o qual é compartilhado por todos aqueles ao redor do mundo que estão aflitos, e que, apesar de gritarem e gritarem, não podem ser ouvidos por ninguém.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……世界上傷心至極的人們，那“為什麼我都在如此呼喊了，卻誰都聽不到呢”的無聲哀嘆，確確實實地被嘉音聽到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……世界上伤心至极的人们，那“为什么我都在如此呼喊了，却谁都听不到呢”的无声哀叹，确确实实地被嘉音听到了。
Italian (IT): Kanon aveva senz'altro sentito quella richiesta di aiuto senza voce per cui miriadi di persone nel mondo gemevano dal dolore, lamentando il perché, a prescindere da quanto esse venissero urlate, non venivano mai udite.
Turkish (TR): ......Kanon, dünyanın dört bir yanında üzüntü yaşayanların paylaştığı ve çığlık çığlığa bağırsalar da kimse tarafından duyulamayan o sessiz yardım çağrısını kesinlikle duydu.

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon softly knelt by Jessica's side, and wordlessly offered her a shoulder.
Steam (ST): Kanon quietly knelt by Jessica's side and wordlessly offered her a shoulder.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon softly knelt by Jessica's side, and wordlessly offered her a shoulder.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音はそっと朱志香の脇に跪き、無言で肩を貸した。
Russian (RU): Канон молча опустился на колено перед Джессикой и, не говоря ни слова, подставил ей плечо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon suavemente se ajoelhou ao lado de Jessica, e silenciosamente ofereceu um ombro a ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音在朱志香的身邊悄無聲息地跪下，默默地用肩膀擔起了她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音在朱志香的身边悄无声息地跪下，默默地用肩膀担起了她。
Italian (IT): Kanon si inginocchiò dolcemente al fianco di Jessica, offrendole il suo supporto senza dire una parola...
Turkish (TR): Kanon usulca Jessica'nın yanına diz çöktü, ve sözsüz bir şekilde ona omuz verdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Even as Jessica kept coughing painfully, she accepted it, .........unlocked her room, and entered...
Steam (ST): ...Though Jessica kept coughing painfully, she accepted it, ......unlocked the door to her room, and entered...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though Jessica kept coughing painfully, she accepted it, .........opened the lock to her room, and entered...
PC Japanese (JP): ……朱志香は苦しい咳を繰り返しながらも、それを借り、………自分の部屋の鍵を開け、入る…。
Russian (RU): ......Хоть Джессика и продолжала мучительно кашлять, она взялась за него, открыла замок в свою комнату и вошла...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo enquanto Jessica continuava tossindo dolorosamente, ela o aceitou, .........destrancou o seu quarto, e entrou...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖然朱志香仍在痛苦地不斷咳嗽著，但她還是靠在了這肩膀上，………打開自己房間的鎖，進了房…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然朱志香仍在痛苦地不断咳嗽着，但她还是靠在了这肩膀上，………打开自己房间的锁，进了房…。
Italian (IT): Nonostante Jessica continuasse a tossire in maniera sofferente, lei accettò, aprì la serratura della sua stanza, ed entrò...
Turkish (TR): ......Jessica acı içinde öksürmeye devam etse de, yardımı kabul etti, .........odasının kilidini açtı ve içeri girdi...

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "............This way. ...............I'll prepare your medicine right away."
Steam (ST): "......This way. ......I'll prepare your medicine right away."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............This way. ............I'll prepare your medicine right away."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………こちらへ。……………今、お薬をご用意します。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………こちらへ。……………今、お薬をご用意します」
Russian (RU): "............Сюда. ............Я сейчас же приготовлю ваше лекарство."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Por aqui. ...............Prepararei o seu remédio de imediato."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………請往這邊。……………立刻就為您備藥。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………请往这边。……………立刻就为您备药。」
Italian (IT): "...Da questa parte... Adesso le preparo la sua medicina."
Turkish (TR): "............Bu taraftan. ...............Hemen ilacınızı vereceğim."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): ".........*cough*cough*cough*...! ......*co-, ......*cough*cough*cough*...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………ごほんごほんごほん…！………くッ、………ゲヘガハゴホッ…！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………ごほんごほんごほん…！　………くッ、………ゲヘガハゴホッ…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (IT): "...Cough, cough, cough...! G-Gack, gack, cough...!!"
Turkish (TR): "..................*öksürme*öksürme*öksürme*...! .........*ök.........*öksürme*öksürme*öksürme*...!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica had often said that when she let her asthma run its course, it hurt so badly that it felt like she would vomit her whole stomach.
Steam (ST): Jessica often said that when her asthma got serious enough, it hurt so bad that it felt like she'd vomit up her whole stomach.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica had often said that when her asthma got serious enough, it hurt so bad that it felt like she would vomit her whole stomach.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香はよく、喘息をし尽くすと胃袋丸ごとを吐き出しそうになるような苦しみになると口にしていた。
Russian (RU): Джессика не раз говорила, что когда у неё обострялась астма, ей становилось так плохо, что казалось, словно у неё рвётся весь живот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica frequentemente dizia que quando ela deixava a asma seguir seu curso, doía tanto que parecia que ela vomitaria seu estômago todo.

PC Japanese (JP): ………そして、それを口にし、朱志香の何かの気持ちを裏切った日を思い出して、…嘉音の心が軋んだが、……それは今の朱志香の悲しみに比べればはるかに不謹慎な感情だと思い、心の奥底に押し止める…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Então ele lembrou do dia em que havia falado aquela palavra, e de alguma forma traído os sentimentos de Jessica, ...o que abalou o coração de Kanon, ......mas comparado à tristeza atual de Jessica, ele pensou naquilo como uma emoção muito mais imprudente, e a suprimiu às profundezas de seu coração...

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且，想要保护之人发出了求救，她就身在对面的房间里。
Italian (IT): E dall'altra parte, c'era la persona che voleva proteggere, e che gli stava chiedendo aiuto.
Turkish (TR): ......Korumak istediği kişi de çok uzaklardan...bu yöne doğru yardım istiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): It was obvious what he should do.{n}It wasn't logical. It was an electric reaction.{n}Without a trace of hesitation or idle thoughts.
Steam (ST): It was obvious what he should do. It wasn't logical. It was an electric reflex. Without a trace of hesitation or distraction.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was obvious what he should do. It wasn't logical. It was an electric reaction. Without a trace of hesitation or idle thoughts.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分のすべきことは明白だった。それは理屈じゃない。電気的で反射的。一切の躊躇も雑念もない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 自分のすべきことは明白だった。{n}それは理屈じゃない。電気的で反射的。{n}一切の躊躇も雑念もない。
Russian (RU): То, что ему следовало сделать, было очевидным.{n}Это был не разум. Простая машинальная реакция.{n}Без малейшего колебания или задней мысли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era óbvio o que ele deveria fazer.{n}Não era lógico. Era uma reação elétrica.{n}Sem quaisquer traços de hesitação ou pensamentos inúteis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自己該做的事，已是明明白白。{n}這不是以情理來推動。而是如電流，如條件反射。{n}沒有一絲猶豫與雜念。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自己该做的事，已是明明白白。{n}这不是以情理来推动。而是如电流，如条件反射。{n}没有一丝犹豫与杂念。
Italian (IT): Era palese cosa avrebbe dovuto fare.{n}Non era logica. Fu un riflesso istintivo.{n}Privo di qualsiasi esitazione o vaneggiamento...
Turkish (TR): Ne yapması gerektiği çok açıktı.{n}Mantığa dayanmıyordu. Elektriksel bir refleksti.{n}En ufak bir tereddüt ya da gereksiz düşünce yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...The person he wanted to protect was there, and asking for help. .........So, in that moment, he genuinely felt that he wanted to be the person who was there with her.
Steam (ST): ...There was a person he wanted to protect, and she was asking for help. ......And, at that moment, he genuinely wanted the person by her side to be him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The person he wanted to protect was there, and asking for help..........Therefore, in that moment, he genuinely felt that he wanted to be the person who was there with her.
PC Japanese (JP): …守りたい人がいて、助けを求めていて。………だからその瞬間、そこにいるのが自分でありたいという純粋な気持ち。
Russian (RU): ...Девушка, которую он хотел защитить, была там и просила о помощи. .........И тогда, в этот самый момент, он почувствовал, что хочет быть тем человеком, кто будет рядом с ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...A pessoa que ele queria proteger estava ali, pedindo ajuda. .........Então, naquele momento, ele genuinamente sentiu que queria ser a pessoa que estaria ali com ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …自己有著想要保護之人，而她發出了求救。………因此在這一瞬間，心中充斥的，是希望她身旁之人就是自己的純粹情感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …自己有着想要保护之人，而她发出了求救。………因此在这一瞬间，心中充斥的，是希望她身旁之人就是自己的纯粹情感。
Italian (IT): La persona che voleva proteggere era lì, e gli stava chiedendo aiuto... Pertanto, in quel momento, desiderava genuinamente essere lì con lei.
Turkish (TR): ...Korumak istediği bir kişi vardı ve yardım istiyordu. .........Dolayısıyla, o anda, gerçekten orada onunla birlikte olan kişi olmak istediğini hissetti.

Umineko Project (UP): When he flew into Jessica's room, his eyes latched on to a bizarre scene.
Steam (ST): When he flew into Jessica's room, the scene that greeted his eyes was a bizarre one.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he flew into Jessica's room, his eyes latched on to a bizarre scene.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香の部屋に飛び込んだ時、その目に飛び込んできたのは異様な光景だった。
Russian (RU): Когда он влетел в комнату Джессики, то увидел странную сцену.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ele voou para dentro do quarto de Jessica, seus olhos se fixaram em uma cena bizarra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 飛奔進朱志香房間時，異樣的光景躍入了眼簾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 飞奔进朱志香房间时，异样的光景跃入了眼帘。
Italian (IT): Quando si precipitò nella stanza di Jessica, si palesò davanti ai suoi occhi una bizzarra visione.
Turkish (TR): Jessica'nın odasına daldığında, gözleri tuhaf bir manzarayla karşılaştı.

Umineko Project (UP): The room was a fantastical world, where a blizzard of golden powder danced, almost as though gold leaf had been scattered inside a snow globe.
Steam (ST): The room had become a fantastical world, where a blizzard of gold-colored specks danced, almost as though gold leaf had been scattered inside a snow globe.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The room was a fantastical world, where a blizzard of gold-colored specks danced, almost as though gold leaf had been scattered inside a snow globe.
PC Japanese (JP): 部屋は、金色の粉吹雪が舞い、まるでスノーグローブの中で金箔を舞い散らせているような幻想的な世界だった。
Russian (RU): Комната стала фантастическим миром, где кружил золотой буран, как если бы золотые листья поместили внутрь снежного шара.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quarto era um mundo fantasioso, onde um turbilhão de pó dourado dançava, quase como se folhas douradas tivessem sido espalhadas dentro de um globo de neve.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 房間裡飄舞著金色的飛雪，宛如雪花玻璃球中四散飄落著金箔一般的，一幕充滿幻想的世界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 房间里飘舞着金色的飞雪，宛如雪花玻璃球中四散飘落着金箔一般的，一幕充满幻想的世界。
Italian (IT): Nella stanza c'era un mondo onirico, in cui turbinava una tempesta di polvere dorata, come se dei frammenti di una lamina d'oro stessero svolazzando all'interno di una palla di vetro...
Turkish (TR): Oda, sanki bir kar küresinin içine altın yapraklar serpiştirilmiş gibi, altın tozundan bir kar fırtınasının dans ettiği fantastik bir dünyaydı.

Umineko Project (UP): .........No, that's not it.{n}I've seen this spectacle before.{n}This isn't gold leaf.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........No, that's not it. I've seen this spectacle before. This isn't gold leaf.

Russian (RU): .........Нет, не совсем.{n}Я уже видел этот сцену раньше.{n}Это не золотые листья.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………不，錯了。{n}我以前也見過這副情景。{n}這不是金箔。

Steam (ST): ...It's countless golden butterflies, {f:5:Beatrice}'s minions!!

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......São incontáveis borboletas douradas, ou seja, servos de {f:5:Beatrice}!!

Turkish (TR): ......Bunlar sayısız altın kelebekler—{f:5:Beatrice}'in yardakçıları!!

Umineko Project (UP): ...The butterflies, beautiful yet filthy, surrounded Jessica's face, trying to crawl in through her mouth and nose.
Steam (ST): ...The butterflies, which were sickening despite their beauty, surrounded Jessica's face, trying to crawl in through her mouth and nose.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The butterflies, which were both beautiful and filthy, surrounded Jessica's face, trying to crawl in through her mouth and nose.

Russian (RU): ...Золотые бабочки были отвратительны настолько же, насколько и прекрасны, и облепляли лицо Джессики, пытаясь залезть ей в рот и нос.

Turkish (TR): Jessica hiddetle öğürmeye başladı.

Umineko Project (UP): Indeed, when Kanon ran towards Jessica as she choked, the butterflies stopped attacking her, and this time, they began to elegantly dance a rondo around the two.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But when Kanon ran towards Jessica as she choked, the butterflies stopped attacking her, and this time, they began to elegantly dance a rondo around the two.
PC Japanese (JP): だって、嘉音が駆けつけ朱志香が咽込んだら、蝶たちは襲うのをやめ、今度は二人の周りを優雅に、ロンドのように舞い始めたから。
Russian (RU): Но когда Канон подбежал к кашляющей Джессике, бабочки перестали атаковать её и стали элегантно кружить вокруг них, как будто исполняя какой то изысканный танец.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De fato, quando Kanon correu na direção de Jessica enquanto ela sufocava, as borboletas pararam de atacá‐la, e desta vez, elas começaram a elegantemente dançar um rondó ao redor dos dois.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為，在嘉音跑上前來，朱志香開始咳嗽不止時，蝶群就放棄了襲擊，而是圍繞著兩人，跳起了優雅的輪舞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为，在嘉音跑上前来，朱志香开始咳嗽不止时，蝶群就放弃了袭击，而是围绕着两人，跳起了优雅的轮舞。
Italian (IT): Ma quando Kanon, vedendola soffocare, si precipitò da Jessica, le farfalle smisero di assalirla, e subito dopo, iniziarono a danzare intorno ai due a ritmo di un rondò.

Umineko Project (UP): And it seemed that the witch had already ordered that.{n}And she faced Kanon with an expectant gaze.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): And it seemed that the witch had already ordered that. And she faced Kanon with an expectant gaze.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She faced him with a provocative gaze filled with expectation, as though asking him how he planned to protect this maiden!

Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had predicted that the witch's target would be the complete opposite of fair and honest, ...his back.

Umineko Project (UP): But she had no way to block it.{n}...She had no aspirations to martyrdom.{n}She simply thought that there was no way other than this to protect Kanon's back.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「即使经过百年，家具也只不过是家具！这世上哪会有为扔掉的家具挖墓穴的笨蛋啊？家具要劈碎了当成柴火来烧，烧过之后就只会剩下灰！！」
Italian (IT): "Potranno passare cent'anni, un mobile rimarrà sempre un mobile! Quale razza di idiota scaverebbe una tomba per un mobile quando lo getta via? Farà a pezzi il mobile per farci della legna da ardere, e tutto ciò che ne rimarrà sarà cenere!!"
Turkish (TR): "Yüz yıl bile geçse, mobilya mobilyadır! Mobilyalarını çöpe attıktan sonra onlar için bir mezar kazacak kadar aptal birini hiç duydun mu? Mobilyaları parçalayıp yakacak odun yaparsın, yani geriye sadece kül kalır!!"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "*cackle*cackle*cackle, that's how it is, no tombstone can be carved for furniture! ......It seems you believe that when you die, you cannot receive any more humiliation, but that's naive, you see...? Steam (ST): "*cackle*cackle*cackle That's how it is: furniture gets no tombstone! ...It seems you believe death means an end to your humiliation, but that's naive... I'll show you what it really means to disgrace the dead. *cackle*cackle*cackle*!!!"

I'll tell you what it really means to disgrace the dead. *cackle*cackle*cackle*!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「くっくくくく、そういうことよ、家具に刻める墓碑などない！　……貴様は死ねばこれ以上の屈辱を受けることがないと信じているようだが、それは甘いぞ…？　死者を辱めるというのがどういうものか、……妾が教えてやろうぞ。くっくっくっくっく！！！」
Russian (RU): "*Хихи*хихи*хихи, вот поэтому у мебели не может быть никакого надгробия! ......Похоже ты уверовал, будто когда ты умрешь, тебя больше нельзя будет унизить? Это наивно, как видишь... Я скажу тебе, что на самом деле означает позор для мёртвого. *Хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "*gargalhada*gargalhada*gargalhada, é assim que é, nenhuma lápide de túmulo pode ser escrita para uma mobília! ......Parece que você acredita que quando morre, não pode receber mais nenhuma humilhação, mas isso é ingenuidade, sabia...? Eu vou lhe ensinar......o que realmente significa desgraçar os mortos. *gargalhada*gargalhada*gargalhada*!!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵呵呵呵呵，就是如此，不會有為了家具而銘刻的墓碑！……你這東西似乎是覺得只要死了就不會再受屈辱了呢，這可有夠天真啊…？就讓妾身來教教你，……什麼叫侮辱死者。呵呵呵呵呵！！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵呵呵呵呵，就是如此，不会有为了家具而铭刻的墓碑！……你这东西似乎是觉得只要死了就不会再受屈辱了呢，这可有够天真啊…？就让妾身来教教你，……什么叫侮辱死者。呵呵呵呵呵！！！」
Italian (IT): "Mhmhmhmhmh, proprio così, non esistono lapidi incise in onore a un mobile...! Sembra che tu creda che una volta morti, non si possa ricevere più alcuna umiliazione, ma è un ragionamento da sprovveduti... Ti insegnerò io... cosa significa oltraggiare i morti. Mhmhmhmhmh!!!"
Turkish (TR): "*cackle*cackle*cackle, işte böyle, mobilyalar için mezar taşı yapılmaz! ......Görünen o ki, öldüğünüzde daha fazla aşağılanmayacağınızı sanıyorsunuz, ama bu çok safça... Size......ölüleri aşağılamanın gerçekte ne demek olduğunu göstereceğim. *cackle*cackle*cackle*!!!"

Umineko Project (UP): After taking a puff from her pipe, the witch breathed the smoke at Kanon's corpse...
Steam (ST): After taking a puff from her pipe, the witch breathed the smoke at Kanon's corpse...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 煙管をひと吸いすると、魔女はその煙を嘉音の死体に吐きかける…。
Russian (RU): Затем, затянувшись трубкой, ведьма выдохнула дым на труп Канона...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de tragar seu cachimbo, a bruxa soprou a fumaça no cadáver de Kanon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女抽了口煙，然後將口中之煙噴向了嘉音的屍體…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女抽了口烟，然后将口中之烟喷向了嘉音的尸体…。
Italian (IT): Dopo aver dato uno sbuffo alla sua pipa, la strega soffiò del fumo sul cadavere di Kanon...
Turkish (TR): Cadı piposundan bir soluk aldıktan sonra dumanı Kanon'un cesedine doğru üfledi...

Umineko Project (UP): ......When she did, Kanon's corpse softly floated up into the air, ...and disappeared as though it had been eaten by a mouth in empty space.
Steam (ST): ...When she did, Kanon's corpse softly floated up into the air...and disappeared as though it had been eaten by a mouth in empty space.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……すると嘉音の体は、すっと宙に浮かび上がり、…虚空の口に食われたかのように掻き消えてしまう。
Russian (RU): ......Когда она сделала это, труп Канона мягко поднялся в воздух... И исчез, как будто оказался проглочен ртом в пустом пространстве.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quando ela fez isso, o cadáver de Kanon suavemente flutuou no ar, ...e desapareceu como se tivesse sido comido por uma boca no espaço vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……接著，嘉音的身體輕飄飄地浮上了半空，…就像是被虛空吃掉了似的，突然間消失無踪了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……接着，嘉音的身体轻飘飘地浮上了半空，…就像是被虚空吃掉了似的，突然间消失无踪了。
Italian (IT): Così facendo, il corpo di Kanon si librò dolcemente in aria... e si volatilizzò, come se una bocca invisibile lo avesse divorato.
Turkish (TR): ......Bunu yaptığında, Kanon'un cesedi yavaşça havaya doğru süzüldü, ...ve boşluktaki bir ağız tarafından yutulmuş gibi ortadan kayboldu.

Umineko Project (UP): The witch played dirty until the very end. ......The two who had understood one another in their last moments—she would not even permit their corpses to be close...
Steam (ST): The witch played dirty until the very end. ...The corpses of the pair who managed to understand each other in the end...were not even permitted to be close...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch played dirty until the very end.......The corpses of the two who had been able to understand each other in the end, were not even permitted to be close to each other...
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は最後まで卑劣だった。……最後に通じ合った二人の遺体を、寄り添わせることすら許さなかったのだ…。
Russian (RU): Ведьма до конца вела грязную игру. ......Трупам двоих, которые смогли понять друг друга к концу своего жизненного пути, даже не позволили быть рядом друг с другом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa jogou sujo até o fim. ......Os dois que haviam entendido um ao outro em seus últimos momentos — ela sequer permitiu que seus cadáveres ficassem juntos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女直至最後都十分卑劣。……她甚至沒有允許，讓那在最後一刻心意相通了的兩人，把遺體緊靠在一起…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女直至最后都十分卑劣。……她甚至没有允许，让那在最后一刻心意相通了的两人，把遗体紧靠在一起…。
Italian (IT): La strega era stata spregevole fino all'ultimo... Ai cadaveri dei due, che erano finalmente riusciti a intendersi, non fu concesso nemmeno di stare vicini...
Turkish (TR): Cadı son ana kadar kirli oynadı. ......Sonunda birbirlerini anlamayı başaran çiftin cesetlerinin birbirlerine yakın olmalarına bile izin verilmedi...

Original Witch Hunt (OG): If someone had been watching, they would probably mourn that this was indeed a disgrace to the dead.
